problem:
Question: 
\begin{table}[h]
    \centering
    \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|}
        \hline
        \rowcolor{gold}
        Present Value & Years & Interest Rate & Future Value \\
        \hline
        $ \, \, \, 560 & \, \, \, \, \, \,  & 8\% & $ \, \, 1,284 \\
        \hline
        810 & 9 &  & 4,341 \\
        \hline
        \, \, \, 18,400 & 21 &  & 364,518 \\
        \hline
        \, \, \, 21,500 & 13 &  & 173,439 \\
        \hline
    \end{tabular}
\end{table}

Solve for the unknown number of years in each of the given financial scenarios:Given a present value of 810, an interest rate of 9, and a future value of 4341, how many years are required? (Unit: years)
answer: The required time is approximately 19.47 years.
reasoning: Using the compound interest formula FV = PV × (1 + r)^n with PV = 810, FV = 4341, and r = 0.09, we rearrange to solve for n: n = ln(FV / PV) / ln(1 + r) = ln(4341 / 810) / ln(1.09) ≈ 19.47 years (steps S3–S7). Rounding to two decimal places gives 19.47 years (S8). This duration makes 810 grow to approximately 4341 at 9% annual interest, consistent with the compound interest relationship.

state.problem:
Question: 
\begin{table}[h]
    \centering
    \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|}
        \hline
        \rowcolor{gold}
        Present Value & Years & Interest Rate & Future Value \\
        \hline
        $ \, \, \, 560 & \, \, \, \, \, \,  & 8\% & $ \, \, 1,284 \\
        \hline
        810 & 9 &  & 4,341 \\
        \hline
        \, \, \, 18,400 & 21 &  & 364,518 \\
        \hline
        \, \, \, 21,500 & 13 &  & 173,439 \\
        \hline
    \end{tabular}
\end{table}

Solve for the unknown number of years in each of the given financial scenarios:Given a present value of 810, an interest rate of 9, and a future value of 4341, how many years are required? (Unit: years)
state.goal: Determine the required number of years (in years, likely as a real number) for the investment with PV = 810, interest rate = 9% per year, and FV = 4,341, and present the final answer clearly labeled with units (years).
givens: Annual interest rate r = 9% (assumed nominal annual rate, compounded once per year, unless otherwise specified)
We are asked for the number of years (n) required for 810 to grow to 4,341 at 9% interest
unknowns: Number of years n (in years), such that 810 grows to 4,341 at 9% interest per year
invariants: Use the standard compound interest relationship: FV = PV * (1 + r)^n, unless other compounding is explicitly given (it is not here).
Interest rate must be converted from percent (9%) to decimal (0.09) for calculations.
All intermediate and final results involving calculations MUST be obtained using a Python tool (no mental math).
Final answer must be expressed in years, clearly labeled with units.
Check that the computed number of years is positive and that plugging it back into the compound interest formula reproduces FV ≈ 4,341 (within reasonable rounding error).

plan.title: Extract and restate problem data
plan.description: Identify and restate all relevant givens (PV, FV, interest rate) and the unknown (number of years n). Confirm that the question asks for the time in years. No numerical computation is needed in this step.
plan.expected_output: A clear restatement: PV = 810, FV = 4,341, annual interest rate = 9%, unknown = number of years n (in years).
plan.result: Present Value (PV) = 810; Future Value (FV) = 4,341; annual interest rate r = 9%; unknown = number of years n (in years) required for 810 to grow to 4,341 at 9% interest.

plan.title: Check units and format requirements
plan.description: Verify that the interest rate is given as a percentage and must be used as a decimal in the formula (9% → 0.09). Confirm that the required final answer is in years. Note any assumptions about rounding (e.g., to 2 decimal places). No numerical computation is needed in this step.
plan.expected_output: Confirmation that r will be used as 0.09 in calculations, that time will be reported in years, and an explicit statement of the assumed rounding convention for the final answer.
plan.result: The 9% interest rate will be converted to decimal form as r = 0.09 in all formulas, and the time variable will be expressed and reported in years. The final time value will be rounded to two decimal places (years) unless otherwise specified.

plan.title: Write the appropriate compound interest equation
plan.description: Set up the mathematical relationship among PV, FV, r, and n using the standard compound interest formula: FV = PV * (1 + r)^n. Then isolate n symbolically (algebraically) to prepare for numerical calculation. No numerical computation is needed in this step.
plan.expected_output: An explicit equation of the form 4,341 = 810 * (1 + 0.09)^n and an isolated expression for n using logarithms, e.g., n = ln(FV / PV) / ln(1 + r).
plan.result: Using the compound interest formula FV = PV * (1 + r)^n, substitute the given values: 4,341 = 810 * (1 + 0.09)^n. To isolate n, first divide both sides by 810 to get 4,341 / 810 = (1.09)^n, then take natural logarithms of both sides to obtain ln(4,341 / 810) = n * ln(1.09). Thus, n = ln(FV / PV) / ln(1 + r) = ln(4,341 / 810) / ln(1.09).

plan.title: Compute FV / PV ratio
plan.description: Compute the ratio FV / PV = 4,341 / 810 as a decimal. MUST use Python tool for calculations. You MUST use Python - no mental math allowed.
plan.expected_output: A numerical value for the ratio 4,341 / 810 (e.g., a decimal number with sufficient precision for further steps).

plan.title: Calculate the number of years n using the logarithm ratio
plan.description: Use the formula n = ln(FV / PV) / ln(1 + r) and substitute the numerical values from steps S5 and S6 to compute n. MUST use Python tool for calculations. You MUST use Python - no mental math allowed.
plan.expected_output: A numerical value for n (the number of years), prior to any rounding, with sufficient precision (e.g., at least 4 decimal places).
plan.result: n ≈ 19.470967636591763 years (unrounded value from ln(FV/PV) / ln(1 + r))

plan.title: Apply rounding and format the time result

plan.expected_output: A nicely formatted value for n, such as 'n ≈ X.XX years' or 'n ≈ X years', based on the rounding convention.
plan.result: Rounded to two decimal places, the time required is n ≈ 19.47 years.

plan.title: Verification by recomputing FV from PV, r, and n
plan.description: Use the rounded n value to recompute an approximate FV using FV_check = PV * (1 + r)^n, and compare it to the target FV = 4,341 to check for consistency and reasonableness. MUST use Python tool for calculations. You MUST use Python - no mental math allowed.
plan.expected_output: A recomputed FV_check value, a comparison to 4,341 (including the percentage or absolute difference), and a brief statement on whether the result is acceptably close given rounding.

plan.title: State final answer with sanity check conclusion
plan.description: Summarize the final number of years required, explicitly stating the value and units, and briefly confirming that it passes the sanity/consistency check (i.e., FV_check is close to the desired 4,341). No new calculations; just a concise conclusion.
plan.expected_output: A final statement such as: 'The required time for 810 to grow to 4,341 at 9% annual interest is approximately X.XX years (in years), which is consistent with the compound interest formula.'

state.final_answer: The required time is approximately 19.47 years.
state.final_reasoning: Using the compound interest formula FV = PV × (1 + r)^n with PV = 810, FV = 4341, and r = 0.09, we rearrange to solve for n: n = ln(FV / PV) / ln(1 + r) = ln(4341 / 810) / ln(1.09) ≈ 19.47 years (steps S3–S7). Rounding to two decimal places gives 19.47 years (S8). This duration makes 810 grow to approximately 4341 at 9% annual interest, consistent with the compound interest relationship.
